cz.syntea.xdef.util

Class PrettyXdef

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.syntea.xdef.util.PrettyXdef

  • public class PrettyXdef
extends java.lang.Object
    Generate formated source of the X-definitions. Also provides main method for calling the program from command line. (see main(String[]))

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      • prettyWrite

        public static void prettyWrite(java.io.File[] files,
                               java.io.File outDir,
                               java.lang.String encoding,
                               java.lang.String newPrefix)
        Write pretty formated files with source X-definitions.
        Parameters:
        files - Array of files.
        outDir - directory where to put result files.
        encoding - The character encoding name or null.
        newPrefix - The new name space prefix (if null the prefix remains unchanged.

        newPrefix - The new name space prefix (if null the prefix remains unchanged.

      • prettyWrite

        public static void prettyWrite(java.io.File input,
                               java.lang.String fname,
                               java.lang.String encoding,
                               java.lang.String newPrefix)
        Write pretty formated file with source X-definition.
        Parameters:
        input - the source file.
        fname - the name of result file.
        encoding - The character encoding name or null.
        newPrefix - The new name space prefix (if null the prefix remains unchanged.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
        Calling the program from command line.
        Parameters:
        args - The array of strings with arguments. [-d outDir | -o outFile] [-i n] [-e encoding] [-p prefix] file
        • -o outFile - output file or output directory. If this parameter is not specified then input file is replaced by the formatted version.
        • -d outDir - output directory. If this parameter is not specified the formated files will be replaced by the the formated version.
        • -i n - number of spaces used for indentation. If this parameter is not specified the parameter is set to 3.
        • -e encoding - name of character set. If this parameter is not specified it will be used the original character set.
        • -p prefix - the prefix of the X-definition name space. If this parameter is not specified it will be used the original prefix.
        • file - the file with source X-definition.
